00060 // The InitializeGame function is responsible for setting up all data and Gaming Engine
00061 // tasks which will run the game

00063 #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
00064 BOOLEAN gubReportMapscreenLock = 0;
00065 void ReportMapscreenErrorLock()
00066 {
00067       switch( gubReportMapscreenLock )
00068       {
00069             case 1:
00070                   DoScreenIndependantMessageBox( L"You have just loaded the game which is in a state that you shouldn't be able to.  You can still play, but there should be a sector with enemies co-existing with mercs.  Please don't report that.", MSG_BOX_FLAG_OK, NULL );
00071                   fDisableDueToBattleRoster = FALSE;
00072                   fDisableMapInterfaceDueToBattle = FALSE;
00073                   gubReportMapscreenLock = 0;
00074                   break;
00075             case 2:
00076                   DoScreenIndependantMessageBox( L"You have just saved the game which is in a state that you shouldn't be able to.  Please report circumstances (ex:  merc in other sector pipes up about enemies), etc.  Autocorrected, but if you reload the save, don't report the error appearing in load.", MSG_BOX_FLAG_OK, NULL );
00077                   fDisableDueToBattleRoster = FALSE;
00078                   fDisableMapInterfaceDueToBattle = FALSE;
00079                   gubReportMapscreenLock = 0;
00080                   break;
00081       }
00082 }
00083 #endif

00085 BOOLEAN InitializeGame(void)
00086 { 
00087       UINT32                        uiIndex;
00088 
00089       giStartingMemValue = MemGetFree( );
00090 
00091       
00092       ClearAllDebugTopics();
00093       RegisterJA2DebugTopic( TOPIC_JA2OPPLIST, "Reg" );
00094       //RegisterJA2DebugTopic( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, "Reg" );
00095 
00096 
00097       // Snap: Read options from an INI file in the default of custom Data directory
00098       // Moved this up because some settings are used during other inits
00099       LoadGameExternalOptions();
00100       InitSightRange(); //lal
00101 
00102       // Initlaize mouse subsystems
00103       MSYS_Init( );
00104       InitButtonSystem();
00105       InitCursors( );
00106 
00107       // Init Fonts
00108       if ( !InitializeFonts( ) )
00109       {
00110             // Send debug message and quit
00111             DebugMsg( TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3, "COULD NOT INUT FONT SYSTEM...");
00112             return( ERROR_SCREEN );
00113       }
00114 
00115       //Deletes all the Temp files in the Maps\Temp directory
00116       InitTacticalSave( TRUE );
00117 
00118       // Initialize Game Screens.
00119   for (uiIndex = 0; uiIndex < MAX_SCREENS; uiIndex++)
00120   { 
00121     if ((*(GameScreens[uiIndex].InitializeScreen))() == FALSE)
00122     { // Failed to initialize one of the screens. 
00123       return FALSE;
00124     }
00125   }
00126 
00127       //Init the help screen system
00128       InitHelpScreenSystem();
00129 
00130       //Loads the saved (if any) general JA2 game settings
00131       LoadGameSettings();
00132 
00133       //Initialize the Game options ( Gun nut, scifi and dif. levels
00134       InitGameOptions();
00135       
00136       // preload mapscreen graphics
00137       HandlePreloadOfMapGraphics( );
00138 
00139       guiCurrentScreen = INIT_SCREEN;
00140       
00141   return TRUE;
00142 }

00144 // The ShutdownGame function will free up/undo all things that were started in InitializeGame()
00145 // It will also be responsible to making sure that all Gaming Engine tasks exit properly
00146 
00147 void    ShutdownGame(void)
00148 { 
00149       // handle shutdown of game with respect to preloaded mapscreen graphics
00150       HandleRemovalOfPreLoadedMapGraphics( );
00151 
00152        ShutdownJA2( );
00153 
00154       //Save the general save game settings to disk
00155       SaveGameSettings();
00156 
00157 
00158        //shutdown the file database manager
00159        ShutDownFileDatabase( );
00160 
00161 
00162       //Deletes all the Temp files in the Maps\Temp directory
00163       InitTacticalSave( FALSE );
00164 }

00169 // This function exits constantly and reenters constantly

00173 
00174 void GameLoop(void)
00175 {
00176 //    DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop");
00177 
00178       InputAtom                           InputEvent;
00179       POINT  MousePos;
00180       UINT32      uiOldScreen=guiCurrentScreen;
00181 
00182       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: get mouse position");
00183       GetCursorPos(&MousePos);
00184       // Hook into mouse stuff for MOVEMENT MESSAGES
00185       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: get mouse hook");
00186       MouseSystemHook(MOUSE_POS, (UINT16)MousePos.x ,(UINT16)MousePos.y ,_LeftButtonDown, _RightButtonDown);
00187       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: get music");
00188       MusicPoll( FALSE );
00189 
00190       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: check for mouse events");
00191   while (DequeueSpecificEvent(&InputEvent, LEFT_BUTTON_REPEAT|RIGHT_BUTTON_REPEAT|LEFT_BUTTON_DOWN|LEFT_BUTTON_UP|RIGHT_BUTTON_DOWN|RIGHT_BUTTON_UP ) == TRUE )
00192   {
00193             // HOOK INTO MOUSE HOOKS
00194         //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,String("GameLoop: mouse event %d", InputEvent.usEvent ));
00195             switch(InputEvent.usEvent)
00196         {
00197                   case LEFT_BUTTON_DOWN:
00198                         MouseSystemHook(LEFT_BUTTON_DOWN, (INT16)MousePos.x, (INT16)MousePos.y,_LeftButtonDown, _RightButtonDown);
00199                         break;
00200                   case LEFT_BUTTON_UP:
00201                         MouseSystemHook(LEFT_BUTTON_UP, (INT16)MousePos.x, (INT16)MousePos.y ,_LeftButtonDown, _RightButtonDown);
00202                         break;
00203                   case RIGHT_BUTTON_DOWN:
00204                         MouseSystemHook(RIGHT_BUTTON_DOWN, (INT16)MousePos.x, (INT16)MousePos.y,_LeftButtonDown, _RightButtonDown);
00205                         break;
00206                   case RIGHT_BUTTON_UP: 
00207                         MouseSystemHook(RIGHT_BUTTON_UP, (INT16)MousePos.x, (INT16)MousePos.y,_LeftButtonDown, _RightButtonDown);
00208                         break;
00209                   case LEFT_BUTTON_REPEAT: 
00210                         MouseSystemHook(LEFT_BUTTON_REPEAT, (INT16)MousePos.x, (INT16)MousePos.y,_LeftButtonDown, _RightButtonDown);
00211                         break;
00212                   case RIGHT_BUTTON_REPEAT: 
00213                         MouseSystemHook(RIGHT_BUTTON_REPEAT, (INT16)MousePos.x, (INT16)MousePos.y,_LeftButtonDown, _RightButtonDown);
00214                         break;
00215         }
00216       }
00217 
00218       
00219 
00220       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: check for errors");
00221       if ( gfGlobalError )
00222       {
00223             //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: global error");
00224 
00225             guiCurrentScreen = ERROR_SCREEN;
00226       }
00227 
00228 /*
00229       // Madd: removed check because it kept coming up for me, even on new games, even though I have 12GB free!!  I think the "DoesUserHaveEnoughHardDriveSpace" function is busted.
00230       //if we are to check for free space on the hard drive
00231       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: check hard drive");
00232       if( gubCheckForFreeSpaceOnHardDriveCount < DONT_CHECK_FOR_FREE_SPACE )
00233       {
00234             //only if we are in a screen that can get this check
00235             if( guiCurrentScreen == MAP_SCREEN || guiCurrentScreen == GAME_SCREEN || guiCurrentScreen == SAVE_LOAD_SCREEN )
00236             {
00237                   //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: check for free hard drive space");
00238                   if( gubCheckForFreeSpaceOnHardDriveCount < 1 )
00239                   {
00240                         gubCheckForFreeSpaceOnHardDriveCount++;
00241                   }
00242                   else
00243                   {
00244                         // Make sure the user has enough hard drive space
00245                         if( !DoesUserHaveEnoughHardDriveSpace() )
00246                         {
00247                               CHAR16      zText[512];
00248                               CHAR16      zSpaceOnDrive[512];
00249                               UINT32      uiSpaceOnDrive;
00250                               CHAR16      zSizeNeeded[512];
00251 
00252                               swprintf( zSizeNeeded, L"%d", REQUIRED_FREE_SPACE / BYTESINMEGABYTE );
00253                               InsertCommasForDollarFigure( zSizeNeeded );
00254 
00255                               uiSpaceOnDrive = GetFreeSpaceOnHardDriveWhereGameIsRunningFrom( );
00256 
00257                               swprintf( zSpaceOnDrive, L"%.2f", uiSpaceOnDrive / (FLOAT)BYTESINMEGABYTE );
00258 
00259                               swprintf( zText, pMessageStrings[ MSG_LOWDISKSPACE_WARNING ], zSpaceOnDrive, zSizeNeeded );
00260 
00261                               if( guiPreviousOptionScreen == MAP_SCREEN )
00262                                     DoMapMessageBox( MSG_BOX_BASIC_STYLE, (INT16 *)zText, MAP_SCREEN, MSG_BOX_FLAG_OK, NULL );
00263                               else
00264                                     DoMessageBox( MSG_BOX_BASIC_STYLE, zText, GAME_SCREEN, MSG_BOX_FLAG_OK, NULL, NULL );
00265                         }
00266                         gubCheckForFreeSpaceOnHardDriveCount = DONT_CHECK_FOR_FREE_SPACE;
00267                   }
00268             }
00269       }
00270 */
00271       // ATE: Force to be in message box screen!
00272       if ( gfInMsgBox )
00273       {
00274             //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: message box");
00275             guiPendingScreen = MSG_BOX_SCREEN;
00276       }
00277 
00278       if ( guiPendingScreen != NO_PENDING_SCREEN )
00279       {
00280             // Based on active screen, deinit!
00281             if( guiPendingScreen != guiCurrentScreen )
00282             {
00283                   switch( guiCurrentScreen )
00284                   {
00285                         case MAP_SCREEN:
00286                               if( guiPendingScreen != MSG_BOX_SCREEN )
00287                               {
00288                                     EndMapScreen( FALSE );
00289                               }
00290                               break;
00291                         case LAPTOP_SCREEN:
00292                               ExitLaptop();
00293                               break;
00294                   }
00295             }
00296 
00297             // if the screen has chnaged
00298             if( uiOldScreen != guiPendingScreen )
00299             {
00300                   // Set the fact that the screen has changed
00301                   uiOldScreen = guiPendingScreen;
00302 
00303                   HandleNewScreenChange( guiPendingScreen, guiCurrentScreen );
00304             }
00305             guiCurrentScreen = guiPendingScreen;
00306             guiPendingScreen = NO_PENDING_SCREEN;
00307 
00308       }
00309 
00310       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: screen changed");
00311       
00312 
00313   uiOldScreen = (*(GameScreens[guiCurrentScreen].HandleScreen))(); 
00314 
00315       // if the screen has chnaged
00316       if( uiOldScreen != guiCurrentScreen )
00317       {
00318             HandleNewScreenChange( uiOldScreen, guiCurrentScreen );
00319             guiCurrentScreen = uiOldScreen;
00320       }
00321 
00322       // rain
00323       RenderRain();
00324 
00325       if( gfSkipFrame )
00326             gfSkipFrame = FALSE;
00327       else
00328       // end rain
00329 
00330       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: refresh screen");
00331       RefreshScreen( NULL );
00332 
00333       guiGameCycleCounter++;
00334 
00335       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop: update clock");
00336       UpdateClock();
00337 
00338       #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
00339       if( gubReportMapscreenLock )
00340       {
00341             ReportMapscreenErrorLock();
00342       }
00343       #endif
00344 
00345       //DebugMsg (TOPIC_JA2,DBG_LEVEL_3,"GameLoop done");
00346 }

00348 void SetCurrentScreen( UINT32 uiNewScreen )
00349 {
00350       guiCurrentScreen = uiNewScreen;
00351  (*(GameScreens[guiCurrentScreen].HandleScreen))(); 
00352 
00353 }

00360 // rain
00361 extern UINT32 guiRainLoop;
00362 // end rain
00363 
00364 // Gets called when the screen changes, place any needed in code in here
00365 void HandleNewScreenChange( UINT32 uiNewScreen, UINT32 uiOldScreen )
00366 {     
00367       //if we are not going into the message box screen, and we didnt just come from it
00368       if( ( uiNewScreen != MSG_BOX_SCREEN && uiOldScreen != MSG_BOX_SCREEN ) )
00369       {
00370             //reset the help screen
00371             NewScreenSoResetHelpScreen( );
00372       }
00373 
00374       //rain
00375       if( uiNewScreen == MAP_SCREEN )
00376       {
00377             if ( guiRainLoop != NO_SAMPLE )
00378             {
00379                   SoundStop( guiRainLoop );
00380                   guiRainLoop = NO_SAMPLE;
00381             }
00382       }
00383       // end rain
00384 }
00385 
00386 void HandleShortCutExitState( void )
00387 {
00388       // look at the state of fGameIsRunning, if set false, then prompt user for confirmation
00389 
00390       // use YES/NO Pop up box, settup for particular screen
00391       SGPRect pCenteringRect= {0, 0, SCREEN_WIDTH, INV_INTERFACE_START_Y };
00392 
00393       if( guiCurrentScreen == ERROR_SCREEN )
00394       { //an assert failure, don't bring up the box!
00395             gfProgramIsRunning = FALSE;
00396             return;
00397       }
00398 
00399       if( guiCurrentScreen == AUTORESOLVE_SCREEN )
00400       {
00401             DoMessageBox(  MSG_BOX_BASIC_STYLE, pMessageStrings[ MSG_EXITGAME ],  guiCurrentScreen, ( UINT8 ) ( MSG_BOX_FLAG_YESNO | MSG_BOX_FLAG_USE_CENTERING_RECT ),  EndGameMessageBoxCallBack,  &pCenteringRect );
00402             return;
00403       }
00404 
00405       /// which screen are we in?
00406       if ( (guiTacticalInterfaceFlags & INTERFACE_MAPSCREEN ) )
00407       {
00408             // set up for mapscreen
00409             DoMapMessageBox( MSG_BOX_BASIC_STYLE,(INT16 *) pMessageStrings[ MSG_EXITGAME ], MAP_SCREEN, MSG_BOX_FLAG_YESNO, EndGameMessageBoxCallBack );
00410 
00411       }
00412       else if( guiCurrentScreen == LAPTOP_SCREEN )
00413       {
00414             // set up for laptop
00415             DoLapTopSystemMessageBox( MSG_BOX_LAPTOP_DEFAULT, (INT16 *) pMessageStrings[ MSG_EXITGAME ], LAPTOP_SCREEN, MSG_BOX_FLAG_YESNO, EndGameMessageBoxCallBack );
00416       }
00417       else if( guiCurrentScreen == SHOPKEEPER_SCREEN )
00418       {
00419             DoSkiMessageBox( MSG_BOX_BASIC_STYLE, (STR16)pMessageStrings[ MSG_EXITGAME ], SHOPKEEPER_SCREEN, MSG_BOX_FLAG_YESNO, EndGameMessageBoxCallBack );
00420       }
00421       else
00422       {
00423 
00424             // check if error or editor
00425 #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
00426             if ( guiCurrentScreen == AIVIEWER_SCREEN || guiCurrentScreen == QUEST_DEBUG_SCREEN )
00427             {
00428                   // then don't prompt
00429                   gfProgramIsRunning = FALSE;
00430                   return;
00431             }
00432 #endif
00433 
00434             if( ( guiCurrentScreen == ERROR_SCREEN ) || ( guiCurrentScreen == EDIT_SCREEN ) || ( guiCurrentScreen == DEBUG_SCREEN ) )
00435             {
00436                   // then don't prompt
00437                   gfProgramIsRunning = FALSE;
00438                   return;
00439             }
00440 
00441             // set up for all otherscreens
00442             DoMessageBox(  MSG_BOX_BASIC_STYLE, pMessageStrings[ MSG_EXITGAME ],  guiCurrentScreen, ( UINT8 ) ( MSG_BOX_FLAG_YESNO | MSG_BOX_FLAG_USE_CENTERING_RECT ),  EndGameMessageBoxCallBack,  &pCenteringRect );
00443       }
00444 }

00446 
00447 void EndGameMessageBoxCallBack( UINT8 bExitValue )
00448 {
00449       // yes, so start over, else stay here and do nothing for now
00450   if( bExitValue == MSG_BOX_RETURN_YES )
00451       {
00452             gfProgramIsRunning = FALSE;
00453       }
00454 
00455       //If we are in the tactical placement gui, we need this flag set so the interface is updated.
00456       if( gfTacticalPlacementGUIActive )
00457       {
00458             gfTacticalPlacementGUIDirty = TRUE;
00459             gfValidLocationsChanged = TRUE; 
00460       }
00461 
00462       return;
00463 }
